snippet: The accusations against Bennett Orfaly, who had opened a restaurant with Representative Michael G. Grimm, became public at a bail hearing for one of the lawmaker’s former fund-raisers.
abstract: Federal prosecutors say Bennett Orfaly, who opened a restaurant in 2006 with Michael G Grimm, has ties to the Gambino organized crime family; restaurant helped Grimm burnish his image and win 2010 Republican campaign for Congressional seat representing Staten Island and part of Brooklyn; prosecutors made accusation public at bail hearing for Ofer Biton, former campaign fund-raiser for Grimm who is charged with immigration fraud.
lead_paragraph: The accusations against Bennett Orfaly, who had opened a restaurant with Representative Michael G. Grimm, became public at a bail hearing for one of the lawmaker’s former fund-raisers.

headline.seo: Representative Grimm’s Ex-Business Partner Has Mob Ties, Prosecutors Say
headline.main: U.S. Ties Legislator’s Ex-Associate to Mob
headline.print_headline: U.S. Ties Legislator’s Ex-Associate to Mob
